intro: Stachys subsessilis, commonly known as narrow-leaved hedge-nettle, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic foliage. The plant features small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in dense spikes. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Stachys subsessilis is often found in grassy areas and along woodland edges, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils.
